intro: Erucastrum varium subsp. brevirostre, commonly known as the narrow-beaked erucaceous, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. This subspecies is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation.
